Class PreemptiveWaitingSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simcomp.basic.entities.BasicComponentLevelEntity<User,Events>
      • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.general.JEQNElement
        • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.waiting.WaitingSystem
          • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.waiting.PreemptiveWaitingSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.ComponentLevelEntity, it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.GeneralEntity, it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.interfaces.Layer2ToLayer3

    public class PreemptiveWaitingSystem
extends WaitingSystem
    Defines a Waiting System that support resource preemption upon receiving a users with higher priority
    Author:
    Daniele Gianni

                       it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.Time sendingAheadDelay)
                        throws it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException
        Creates a new instance of WaitingSystem
        Parameters:
        name - The entity name
        timeFactory - The time factory to build specific time values
        layer2factory - An implementation of the underlying layer
        userQueue - An implementation of the actual user queue data structure to store the users
        requestGenerator - The service request generator for the following service center
        preemptionPolicy - The policy for the preemption
        sendingAheadDelay - The time delay introduced when the user is forwarded to the next entity
        Throws:
        it.uniroma2.info.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException - Thrown if the provided name does not conform to the underlying name conventions
